Experience Corporate Operations Engineer (Live Streaming Video Engineer) Google April 2011  – Present (4 years 5 months) As a Live Streaming Video Engineer, I provide solutions to stream Google's events live on the web, especially on YouTube. 
 
Our team provides a full cadre of services, ranging from end-to-end production, streaming and publishing of small events to managing the live stream component within full-scale events such as Google IO. As a Corporate Operations Engineer in general, I am familiar with Google's infrastructure and tools, and make use of my technical expertise and knowledge accrued from 2+ years working as an IT Field Tech to innovate our architecture and boost our service offering, while consolidating a sustainable support model in the fast growing market of live video streaming at Google. Corporate Operations Engineer (IT Field Tech) Google, Inc. April 2009  –  April 2011  (2 years 1 month) As a Corporate Operations Engineer (IT Field Technician), I am responsible for assisting employees with all facets of Google's corporate computing environment. I support this environment along with much of the local infrastructure for a site, office, and/or region. My role covers a broad scope of tasks ranging from end-user desktop support to the creation of tools and the automation of processes. In certain cases, I may be called act as a liaison between various other technical and non-technical groups in support of Google's infrastructure and internal services. 
 
Responsibilities: 
Support desktops, laptops and user access to corporate network and applications. 
Support services such as office phones, cell phones, video conferencing and remote access. 
Support Google’s corporate resources and applications. 
Develop solutions to resolve IT issues and needs. 	We solved a practical problem for nation-wide gasoline stations. The volume table for oil storage tank will lose efficacy after a period of usage due to factors like foundation deformation, which will lead to economic loss. We worked out a correction model to re-calibrate the volume table for oil tanks, and used MATLAB to program, validate, and demo our concepts.

Summary Currently working as a Computer Technician and Systems Administrator as well as a full-time student at the University of Akron, I strive to work with the latest advancements in technology and adapt my skill set to suit the needs of the ever-changing technological market. 
 
I enjoy delving into new things to learn them as thoroughly as possible. I am a quick learner that can adapt as needed. 
 
In my experiences, I have worked with consumer and business technology in both a professional and academic setting. Being able to work with businesses in a variety of fields has allowed me to gain insight to the best practices, needs, and workings of a wide range of businesses from medical to manufacturing, and much in-between. 
 
 
My goal is to learn and expand my knowledge for as long as I can. Technology changes rapidly and I hope to bring to you all an up to date skill-set to the table at any time, whether you be a business or individual consumer. Experience IT Field Technician / Corporate Operations Engineer Google April 2015  – Present (5 months) São Paulo Area, Brazil Technical Account Manager Google July 2013  –  April 2015  (1 year 10 months) Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their business with the full support of Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology mavericks who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They handle the partner relationship from pre-sale to post-implementation -- from negotiations through multi-product integrations and on to daily support for products like AdSense, AdMob, DoubleClick, Chrome and many others. Technical Account Managers not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners’ businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need. 
Responsibilities 
Identify, drive and optimize the revenue flow from new business opportunities by leveraging Google technologies 
Perform implementation reviews, evangelize new product features and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges. Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Development and Engineering. 
Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance. 
Analyze and optimize the revenue flow of existing partners and build systems and tools. Assist sales manager in pre-sale activities such as to present product demo and review technical terms in the contracts. 
gTech team serves as the primary point of contact for our global Sales, Business Development, and Partnerships teams to support our sales organization. We provide tools so that our sales teams can focus on what they do best. Our team collaborates with many of Google's engineering groups to create technical solutions that enable our sales organization to help grow our customers' businesses. Corporate Operations Engineer Google Brasil Internet Ltda. September 2006  –  June 2013  (6 years 10 months) São Paulo Area, Brazil As Google grows, the number of Google locations is growing too. We are looking for a IT Field Technician responsible for supporting the needs of Google's Sao Paulo office. We are looking for an individual that is highly technical and can not only directly support all the IT needs of a remote office but also mentor future IT employees.  
 
Position overview: 
Provide direct support for desktops/laptops and user access to corporate network and applications both on the network as well as through remote VPN access. 
Provide direct support for services such as office phones, cell phone, video conferencing and remote access. 
Provide direct support for Google's corporate resources and applications. 
Provide direct support for Google's office relocations and expansions. 
General requirements: 
Experience working in a global IT organization. 
The ability to adjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited information. 
Experience supporting remote users. 
Strong organizational, communication, leadership, and customer service skills. 
Strong project planning and management skills. 
Requirements: 
The ability to configure, upgrade, and relocated PC hardware, software, and print devices. 
Expertise in deploying and supporting cell phones, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices. 
Understanding of LAN/WAN environments. 
Experience with applications in a Microsoft networked environment. 
Excellent knowledge of PC hardware and problem-solving skills. 
BS Degree or equivalent experience. 
Must be fluent in English and Portuguese.
